title: The Female Philosopher - In lines 31-32, speaker

content.prompt: In lines 31-32 (“A soul...burn”), the speaker does which of the following?

choices.label: Realizes that his religion will prevent him from experiencing ordinary love
Hopes to provide an example of the vulgar suitors he has known
Proclaims that he cannot by nature tolerate a lack of dignity in love
Expresses certainty that philosophy and reason are stronger than passion

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
